thread.title: Michelle Keegan enjoys boozy night out in 'extra tight' outfits to dispel pregnancy rumours
thread.title_full: Michelle Keegan enjoys boozy night out in 'extra tight' outfits to dispel pregnancy rumours

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Michelle Keegan enjoys boozy night out in 'extra tight' outfits to dispel pregnancy rumours
text:
Michelle Keegan enjoys boozy night out in 'extra tight' outfits to dispel pregnancy rumours The Tina & Bobby actress is exhausted by speculation about her relationship with Mark Wright Share   
Fed-up Michelle Keegan got drunk over the weekend - in a bid to prove she isn't pregnant. 
The exasperated Our Girl beauty is even choosing extra tight clothes for everyday wear to silence rumours she is expecting her first child. 
Sources say the top actress is exhausted by rumours she is either going to have a baby or her marriage is on the rocks. 
A source told Mirror Online: "Michelle got drunk over the weekend and she really enjoyed it, not only because she was having a great time with friends but because she can finally silence the band of people who think she is pregnant every time she wears a baggy jumper." Michelle Keegan enjoyed a boozy night in a bid to silence the rumours (Photo: michkeegan/Instagram) 
Her rep dismissed the claims at the time - and it's not the first time Michelle has had to respond to speculation . Michelle Keegan is wearing tighter outfits to dispel the rumours (Photo: Getty) 
“I get asked all the time," she said early last year. "If someone sees a bump in my top it's: 'Oh my gosh, she's pregnant.' But, obviously that’s going to happen. 
"I’ve been married for a year now so people are going to ask.” She previously admitted she gets asked all the time (Photo: Getty) Mark and Michelle both have broody phases (Photo: PA) 
And while Mark and Michelle are not planning to have kids just yet, she has admitted she's broody. 
“I love children. I always say I’m broody. We’re not planning anything just yet. 
"Both of us go through phases. I'm about to become an auntie again [to her stepbrother's child] so I'll get my baby fix when he or she is born next year." Like us on Facebook
